results.title: Dr. Seuss video classics
results.creator_credit: Ray Messecar, Tish Rabe, Greenlight Media and Random House
results.brief_description: Dr. Seuss’s incredible tales and wonderful drawings have delighted children of all ages. The picture books are read by well known actors and feature animation and stills.

results.title: Dragon
results.creator_credit: Lucy MacLaren, Paul Goldman and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: Two young girls leave a dragon on a tram and go to the depot at night to find it. Sound: Ann Turner. Continuity: Georgina Wallace-Crabbe. Photography: David Collyer and Paul Goldman.

results.title: Dragonheart
results.creator_credit: Rob Cohen, Raffaella De Laurentiis and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Bowen (Quaid) is a knight dedicated to the Old Code, a noble creed of honour in a time long ago when majestic fire breathers soared through the skies. Bowen dedicates his time to instructing worthy pupils of the Old Code. He is disillusioned when one of his pupils, Prince Einon, becomes a cruel King, and Bowen loses faith in the idealism that was once the source of his inner strength. Believing Einon’s soul to have been poisoned by a dragon, Bowen vows to destroy all dragons - without question or mercy. It is on this revenge quest for the good soul of Prince Einon that Bowen meets Draco (voice provided by Sean Connery), a dragon whose power, strength and wit are not easily defeated. As man and dragon contest in a life or death struggle, a friendship is formed that will change the face of the medieval world forever. Cast includes Dennis Quaid, David Thewlis, Pete Postlethwaite, Julie Christie and Dina Meyer.

results.title: Dr. T & the women = Dr T and the women [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Robert Altman, James McLindon and Sandcastle 5
results.brief_description: ‘Dr.T & the women’ brings together an ensemble cast including Richard Gere, Helen Hunt, Farrah Fawcett and Kate Hudson. Gere plays Dr.T, a Dallas gynaecologist with a bevy of beautiful women who worship him. With his daughter’s wedding imminent, his wife’s lack of mental stability, his alcoholic sisters and her 3 children, it’s no wonder he finds solace in the arms of Bree, new pro teacher at the golf club.

results.title: Dracula
results.creator_credit: Tod Browning, Carl Laemmle Jnr and Universal Studios
results.brief_description: Possibly the most enduring vampire film of all, Tod Browning’s Dracula (1931) owes much to the performance of its male lead, Bela Lugosi, and the expressionistic cinematography of Karl Freund, who had previously worked with F.W. Murnau, director of Nosferatu (1922). Lugosi’s portrayal of the suave but deadly Count in this film, based on a play adaptation of Stoker’s novel, was so memorable that it influenced countless imitations, and brought the former stage actor to great prominence. The film opens with English real estate agent, Renfield (Dwight Frye), travelling to Transylvania to the remote castle of Count Dracula to close a deal on the rental of a London property. Succumbing to the Count’s sinister spell, Renfield returns to England on a ship loaded with coffins, where his deranged ramblings promptly cause him to be institutionalised. Dracula (Lugosi), meanwhile, sets up residence in his new home, Carfax Abbey, and begins prowling the misty night streets of London for new victims. Attempting to insinuate himself into high society, he attends the opera, where he meets Dr. Seward, the owner of the institution housing Renfield, who introduces him to his daughter, Mina, her fiance Jonathon, and Mina’s friend Lucy. Lucy quickly falls under Dracula’s dark spell, and becomes a vampire, preying on small children. Dr. Seward, alarmed by the number of victims exhibiting similar marks on their necks, calls in Professer Van Helsing (Edward Van Sloan), who voices his suspicions of vampirism. Renfield, torn between the call of the vampire and the last shreds of his humanity, warns them that Mina is in danger. It does not take long for Van Helsing to deduce who he is warning them against after crossing paths with the Count at the Seward’s home. Rallying the doctor and Mina’s fiance, Van Helsing enters a desperate struggle to save Mina’s immortal soul. Also featured is a short documentary, The Road to Dracula, produced, written and directed by David J. Skal, which discusses the making of the film, and offers opinions on why the character of Dracula is so enduring.

results.title: Dr. Strangelove or How I learned to stop worrying and love the bomb [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Ken Adam, Stanley Kubrick, Victor Lyndon and Columbia
results.brief_description: A crazy General, Jack D. Ripper, obsessed by the fear that the Communists are controlling the fluoridation of the U.S. water supply, unleashes his wing of H-bombers against Russia. The President of the United States, his Chiefs of Staff at the Pentagon and even the sinister Dr. Strangelove, realise it is too late to call off the attack so they await the awesome consequences. This controversial black comedy stars Peter Sellers in three separate roles; other stars include George C. Scott, Sterling Hayden and Slim Pickens. In turn hilarious, satirical and even terrifying, Dr. Strangelove is a guide on How To Stop Worrying and Love The Bomb.

results.title: Dr Plughole
results.brief_description: Matthew’s evening bath is interrupted by a visit from the water wizard Dr. Plughole. Combining animation and live action into comic adventure, “Dr. Plughole” shows young Matthew how exciting the water cycle is and how important it is for our everyday lives. Principles covered are evaporation, condensation and precipitation.

results.title: Dr Jekyll and Mr Hyde
results.creator_credit: Victor Fleming, Victor Saville and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description:
As part of an experiment to separate the good and bad sides of men’s souls, Dr Harry Jekyll drinks his own potion and turns into Mr Hyde, his evil self. When his fiancee is taken abroad, the lonely Jekyll turns to Hyde for release. He ensnares a pretty barmaid and keeps her a virtual prisoner. Hyde soon begins to overpower Jekyll, and the doctor becomes trapped in a vortex of cruelty and murder.
Cast includes: Spencer Tracy, Ingrid Bergman, and Lana Turner.

results.title: Downhill
results.creator_credit: Robin Spry, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Actor Michael Kane stars in this brief winter romance filmed partly in the dazzling outdoor splendor of a Laurentian ski resort and partly in the cardiac wing of a city hospital. It is the story of a man’s second youth, the time in his middle years when he overstrains his passion for life and love. A stolen weekend, and the inevitable reckoning; between these two, the hills themselves serve the drama like members of the cast.

results.title: Dr Terror's house of horror
results.creator_credit: Freddy Frances, Paul Stone and Amicus Productions
results.brief_description: During the 1960s and 70s, Amicus Productions were one of the most popular horror movie-making studios. “Dr Terror’s house of horror” was the first Amicus film, and with its portmanteau structure, features an array of supernatural settings. In a railway carriage sit five men; a mysterious doctor joins them and offers to tell their terrible fortunes. In them, a werewolf menaces a realtor; an art critic is terrorised by the severed hand of a disgruntled artist; a third man suspects his wife is a vampire; a jazz musician is pursued by a voodoo curse; a cottage is besieged by a monster vine. With its frightening narratives, and great cast, this is a wonderfully creepy classic horror experience. Also known as “Blood suckers”.
